```{r}
library(opendatatoronto)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyverse)
library(janitor)
library(knitr)
```



```{r}
#| label: fig-assaultgraphs
#| fig-cap: "Five Neighbourhoods With Highest Assault Rates 2020 & 2021"

library(tidyverse)
assaults <- read.csv("~/Desktop/starter_folder-main/inputs/data/cleaned_assault_data.csv")

assaults <- assaults |>
  mutate(
    Assault_Year =
      recode(
        Assault_Year,
        "2020" = "2020",
        "2021" = "2021"
      )
  )

ggplot(assaults, aes(x = Neighbourhood, y=Assault_Number, fill=Assault_Year)) + geom_bar (stat="identity", position="dodge") + theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, vjust = 0.8, hjust = 0.8))

 ##labs(x="Neighbourhood", y="Assault Number", title="Five Neighbourhoods With Highest Assault Rates 2020 & 2021")

```
